title: Venezuela Lets Some Prisoners Go Home
summary: In Venezuela, some people who were in prison are being let go. This started after the government said it wanted to show kindness and peace. Families waited outside prisons for days, hoping to see their loved ones come out. One young man named Di贸genes Angulo was freed after being in prison for over a year. He was arrested when he was 17 for sharing a video of a protest. Now he is 19 and happy to be with his family again. The government has not said how many prisoners will be released, but a group that helps prisoners says only 16 have been freed so far, while over 800 are still in jail. Some of the prisoners are people who disagreed with the government, like activists and journalists. The U.S. president said this happened because America asked for it. This is a big event in Venezuela as families hope for more releases.

background_read: Venezuela is a country in South America. Sometimes, governments put people in prison for different reasons. In this case, some prisoners are being let go as a sign of goodwill, which means doing something kind to help peace. Families are very happy when their loved ones come home from prison. This story shows how people hope for better times and freedom.
Article_Structure: WHO: Families and prisoners in Venezuela, including Di贸genes Angulo and activists.
WHAT: Venezuela is slowly releasing some prisoners after the government promised to do so for peace.
WHERE: In prisons in Caracas and other places in Venezuela.
WHY: To show kindness and seek peace, with the U.S. saying it asked for this.

perspectives.description: The government says it is releasing prisoners to promote peace and goodwill.
Families are hopeful and happy to reunite with loved ones after long waits.
